name: Areca Palm
definition: Dypsis lutescens is a clumping, tropical palm tree known for its slender, arching fronds with feathery leaflets and yellowishstems. It’s widely grown as an ornamental plant for indoor decor and outdoor landscaping in warm climates.
origin: Native to Madagascar (eastern and northwestern regions); it has been naturalized in parts of Southeast Asia, Australia, and the Caribbean.
scientificClass: •Domain: Eukaryote • Kingdom: Plantae • Division: Magnoliophyta • Class: Liliopsida (Monocotyledons) • Order: Arecales • Family: Arecaceae (Palm family) • Genus: Dypsis • Species: D. lutescens
type: The type species of the genus Dypsis is Dypsis pinnatifrons (not D. lutescens). D. lutescens is a prominent species within the genus but not the type.
synonyms: • Chrysalidocarpus lutescens H.Wendl. (most common former name) • Areca lutescens (H.Wendl.) Baill. • Neodypsis lutescens (H.Wendl.) Beentje & J.Dransf.
benefits: • Air purification: Removes formaldehyde, benzene, and trichloroethylene (per NASA’s clean air study). • Ornamental value: Enhances indoor/outdoor aesthetics with its lush, tropical look. • Humidity regulation: Adds moisture to indoor air. • Non-toxic: Safe for cats and dogs (per ASPCA). • Soil stabilization: Helps prevent erosion in outdoor plantings.
lifeSpan: • Indoor: Typically 10–20 years with proper care (bright light, regular watering, well-drained soil). • Outdoor (tropical climates): Can live 20–50 years or more, forming large, dense clumps over time.

name: Aloe vera (L.) Burm. F.
definition: Aloe vera is a stemless or short-stemmed succulent plant in the Asphodelaceae family, known for its thick, fleshy, serrated leaves that contain a gel-rich in bioactive compounds. It's widely cultivated for medicinal, cosmetic, and ornamental use.
origin: Native to the Arabian Peninsula; it grows wild in tropical, subtropical, and arid regions worldwide and is naturalized in many areas (considered invasive in some).
scientificClass: • Domain: Eukaryote • Kingdom: Plantae • Division: Magnoliophyta • Class: Liliopsida • Order: Asparagales • Family: Asphodelaceae • Genus: Aloe • Species: A. vera
type: The type species of the genus Aloe is Aloe perfoliata (not A. vera). A. vera is a well-known species but not the type.
synonyms: • Aloe barbadensis Mill. • Aloe indica Royle • Aloe vulgaris Lam. • Aloe chinensis (Haw.) Baker • Aloe perfoliata var. vera L. • Aloe flava Pers.
benefits: • Topical use: Soothes sunburns and skin irritation. • Hair care: Nourishes scalp and strengthens hair. • Internal use: Aids digestion (consult doctor). • Ornamental: Easy to grow indoors.
lifeSpan: Indoor/outdoor: With proper care, it can live 20 years or more. In ideal tropical conditions, some plants survive decades.

name: Madagascar periwinkle
definition: An evergreen, tender, erect-to-spreading perennial in the dogbane family (Apocynaceae). The species epithet means 'pink.'
origin: Native to the island of Madagascar.
scientificClass: • Domain: Eukaryote • Kingdom: Plantae • Division: Magnoliophyta • Class: Magnoliopsida • Order: Gentianales • Family: Apocynaceae • Genus: Catharanthus • Species: C. roseus
type: Evergreen, tender, erect-to-spreading perennial in the dogbane family (Apocynaceae).
synonyms: • Vinca rosea • Acokanthera rosea • Lochnera rosea
benefits: • Traditional medicine: Used for headaches and vertigo. • Anti-cancer: Source of vinblastine and vincristine for chemotherapy. • Antioxidant activity.
lifeSpan: Perennial, but often grown as an annual or semi-annual plant depending on climate.

name: False Ashoka Tree
definition: A tall, evergreen tree known for its slender, columnar growth habit and wavy-edged leaves.
origin: Native to India and Sri Lanka.
scientificClass: • Domain: Eukaryote • Kingdom: Plantae • Division: Magnoliophyta • Class: Magnoliopsida • Order: Magnoliales • Family: Annonaceae • Genus: Polyalthia • Species: P. longifolia
synonyms: • Mast Tree • Indian Mast Tree • Uvaria longifolia
benefits: • Ornamental landscaping • Natural sound barrier and windbreak • Provides dense shade

name: Ramgoat Dashalong
definition: A perennial, woody herb or erect shrub recognized by its serrated leaves and bright yellow flowers that open in the morning.
origin: Native to the Caribbean basin, Mexico, Central and South America.
scientificClass: • Domain: Eukaryote • Kingdom: Plantae • Division: Tracheophyta • Class: Magnoliopsida • Order: Malpighiales • Family: Passifloraceae • Genus: Turnera • Species: T. ulmifolia
type: The type species of the genus Turnera is Turnera diffusa (not T. ulmifolia).
synonyms: • Turnera alba • Turnera angustifolia • Turnera chamaedrys • Turnera cistoides
benefits: • Ornamental: Attracts butterflies and bees. • Medicinal: Used as expectorant and digestive aid. • Drought-tolerant.
lifeSpan: Perennial; can persist 5-15 years in tropical climates. Grown as an annual in temperate regions.

name: Rubber Fig
definition: A large tropical evergreen tree known for thick, glossy leaves that produce milky latex.
origin: Native to Southeast Asia, particularly India, Nepal, Myanmar, and Indonesia.
scientificClass: • Domain: Eukaryote • Kingdom: Plantae • Division: Magnoliophyta • Class: Magnoliopsida • Order: Rosales • Family: Moraceae • Genus: Ficus • Species: F. elastica
synonyms: • Rubber Tree • Indian Rubber Fig • Rubber Bush
benefits: • Natural air purifier • Improves oxygen and humidity • Popular ornamental plant
lifeSpan: 20-50 years or more with proper care.

name: Song of India
definition: A tropical evergreen shrub with glossy, lance-shaped leaves arranged spirally around the stem.
origin: Native to Madagascar, Mauritius, and nearby islands in the Indian Ocean.
scientificClass: • Domain: Eukaryote • Kingdom: Plantae • Division: Magnoliophyta • Class: Liliopsida • Order: Asparagales • Family: Asparagaceae • Genus: Dracaena • Species: D. reflexa
type: Dracaena reflexa is one of several species; popular varieties include Song of India and Song of Jamaica.
benefits: • Purifies air (removes formaldehyde/xylene) • Low maintenance • Used in feng shui for tranquility
lifeSpan: 10 to 15 years indoors; longer in ideal tropical outdoor conditions.

name: West Indian Jasmine
definition: A flowering tropical shrub known for its bright red, pink, or orange flower clusters.
origin: Native to Southern India and Sri Lanka.
scientificClass: • Domain: Eukaryote • Kingdom: Plantae • Division: Magnoliophyta • Class: Magnoliopsida • Order: Gentianales • Family: Rubiaceae • Genus: Ixora • Species: I. coccinea
synonyms: • Ixora • Jungle Geranium • Flame of the Woods
benefits: • Ornamental landscaping • Traditional medicine for wounds/infections • Attracts butterflies

name: Aratiles Tree
definition: A fast-growing tropical fruit tree known for its small, sweet red berries.
origin: Native to Southern Mexico, Central and South America.
scientificClass: • Domain: Eukaryote • Kingdom: Plantae • Division: Magnoliophyta • Class: Magnoliopsida • Order: Malvales • Family: Muntingiaceae • Genus: Muntingia • Species: M. calabura
type: Muntingia calabura (only species in its genus).
synonyms: • Aratiles • Sarisa • Alatiris • Mansanitas • Jamaican Cherry
benefits: • Edible sweet fruits • Provides shade and attracts birds • Traditional medicine for pain and inflammation

name: Ti Plant
definition: An evergreen shrub prized for its vibrant, colorful foliage, used ornamentally indoors and outdoors.
origin: Native to Southeast Asia, Eastern Australia, and the Pacific Islands.
scientificClass: • Domain: Eukaryote • Kingdom: Plantae • Division: Magnoliophyta • Class: Liliopsida • Order: Asparagales • Family: Asparagaceae • Genus: Cordyline
type: Cordyline fruticosa is the primary species with numerous cultivars.
synonyms: • Cordyline terminalis • Dracaena terminalis • Good-luck plant
benefits: • Ornamental tropical flair • Air purification • Cultural/spiritual significance in Polynesia
lifeSpan: Often 10 years or more with proper care.

name: Snake Plant
definition: A hardy ornamental plant with long upright sword-shaped leaves.
scientificClass: • Domain: Eukaryote • Kingdom: Plantae • Division: Magnoliophyta • Class: Liliopsida • Order: Asparagales • Family: Asparagaceae • Genus: Dracaena • Species: D. trifasciata
benefits: • Air-purifying plant • Low maintenance indoor plant

name: Mulberry Tree
definition: A fruit-bearing tree that produces small sweet edible berries.
scientificClass: • Domain: Eukaryote • Kingdom: Plantae • Division: Magnoliophyta • Class: Magnoliopsida • Order: Rosales • Family: Moraceae • Genus: Morus • Species: M. alba / M. nigra
benefits: • Nutritious fruits • Silkworm rearing (leaves) • Traditional medicine

name: Bloodberry
definition: A tropical American herb with racemes of red berries resembling those of pokeweed.
scientificClass: • Domain: Eukaryote • Kingdom: Plantae • Division: Magnoliophyta • Class: Magnoliopsida • Order: Caryophyllales • Family: Phytolaccaceae • Genus: Rivina • Species: R. humilis
benefits: • Ornamental; attracts birds • Can be used as medicine

name: Devil's Backbone
definition: An erect succulent shrub with green, zig-zag shaped branches.
origin: Native to tropical and subtropical North America and Central America.
scientificClass: • Domain: Eukaryote • Kingdom: Plantae • Division: Magnoliophyta • Class: Magnoliopsida • Order: Malpighiales • Family: Euphorbiaceae • Genus: Euphorbia • Species: E. tithymaloides
benefits: • Ornamental plant • Used in traditional medicine (with caution)

name: Prickly Pear Cactus
definition: A cactus characterized by flat, paddle-shaped stems and spiky thorns.
origin: Native to Mexico and the Americas.
scientificClass: • Domain: Eukaryote • Kingdom: Plantae • Division: Magnoliophyta • Class: Magnoliopsida • Order: Caryophyllales • Family: Cactaceae • Genus: Opuntia • Species: O. ficus-indica
benefits: • Edible fruits (tunas) • Drought resistant • Rich in antioxidants

name: Golden Trumpet
definition: A tropical, evergreen, perennial vine cultivated for its showy, golden yellow flowers.
scientificClass: • Domain: Eukaryote • Kingdom: Plantae • Division: Magnoliophyta • Class: Magnoliopsida • Order: Gentianales • Family: Apocynaceae • Genus: Allamanda • Species: A. cathartica
benefits: • Ornamental • Traditional medicine (laxative/emetic properties in leaves/roots)

name: Dalandan
definition: A small, erect tree with smooth, greenish white shoots and spinescent thorns.
origin: Southeast Asia with origins traced to China.
scientificClass: • Domain: Eukaryote • Kingdom: Plantae • Division: Magnoliophyta • Class: Magnoliopsida • Order: Sapindales • Family: Rutaceae • Genus: Citrus • Species: Citrus aurantium L.
synonyms: • Bitter orange • Seville orange • Sour orange
benefits: • Rich in Vitamin C • Contains antioxidants • Traditional medicine for colds/fever

name: Croton Pictum
definition: A tropical ornamental plant known for thick, glossy, and brightly colored leaves.
scientificClass: • Domain: Eukarya • Kingdom: Plantae • Division: Magnoliophyta • Class: Magnoliopsida • Order: Malpighiales • Family: Euphorbiaceae • Genus: Codiaeum • Species: C. variegatum
benefits: • Decorative foliage • Natural garden divider • Improves aesthetic value
